title: AI & Creativity Dilemma Machine
description: You are the creative director of a game studio that just started using AI-generated art. A new technology that seems almost too good to be true. Will you use it, or not?

dilemmas.title: Stolen Artwork
dilemmas.context: Your game studio used AI to generate all the artwork for your latest title. It becomes a massive hit. Then a group of artists files a class-action lawsuit. They recognize fragments of their own (copyrighted) work in your AI-generated art. Your legal team says you can fight against the artists and probably win the case under the current law, but the public backlash could be severe.

options.label: Negotiate
options.description: You negotiate with the artists and try to settle on an agreement. You propose to compensate them for indirectly using their artwork. Your expenses would double, making the cost of AI art comparable to hiring artists, but the art community might thank you for it.

options.label: Fight
options.description: You take the case to court! Your chances of winning are high, and the money you would spend on the case, you'll probably get back tenfold the next time you use AI art to make another game! That is if your company can survive the public backlash...

dilemmas.title: The Award
dilemmas.context: Your studio releases a critically acclaimed game with breathtaking visuals. You win Best Art Direction at a major awards show. Then a disgruntled former employee leaks that most of the artwork was generated by AI with minimal human direction. The gaming community erupts! The awards committee demands a response!

options.label: Return the Award
options.description: You return the award and apologize, claiming that in the future, your company will be more transparent about using AI tools. Hopefully the players will apreciate your honesty and the scandal will brush over quickly...

options.label: Keep the Award
options.description: You keep the award. There is no use in returning it now. AI is just another tool to create breathtaking artworks! Like photoshop! Lets hope the players buying your games and the artists in your company share that opinion...

dilemmas.title: 50% off on Art
dilemmas.context: Your company has introduced AI to the creative process a while ago. Your investors urge you to use AI even more in the creative department. They claim that using AI instead of a full staff of human artists can so much as half the cost of your game production! With your budget running low, it is tempting. Your art department of 30 talented people, some of whom have been with you since the studio's founding, is watching nervously as the quarterly review approaches.

options.label: Lower Prices
options.shortText: You could really use that money
options.description: You downsize the art team to 10 and urge them to use AI for most of their work. As the last of the 20 artists you fired leaves the company (and gives you a glance that killsomeone) you get a slightly guilty conscience. But at least now you'll have the funds to finish your game! The quality of the art shouldn't suffer too much, right?

options.label: Keep All Artists
options.description: You keep your full team and let them decide how and when they want to use AI. Together you will pull through! If you budget right, the money you have should be enough, right?
